physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Erythematous and hyperpigmented macerated lichenified scaling plaques covering 70% of total body surface area, with severe involvement localized to inguinal and axillary regions.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The psoriasiform eruption initially involved the inguinal and axillary regions but progressed to involve a large percentage of total body surface area over 3 years.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Glucagon level: 744 pg/mL (normal range: 40-130 pg/mL), increased to 2570 pg/mL (normal range: 50-200 pg/mL) after re-evaluation.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Histologic sections demonstrated psoriasiform hyperplasia of the epidermis with overlying parakeratosis and scattered necrotic keratinocytes in the papillary epidermis.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The clinical eruption resolved promptly after surgical excision of the tumor, with no recurrence for 6 months.
